Posted By: Phage123 (7/12/2012 1:00:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You can turn this guy into his Planeswalker version with the help of his own ability.  
  
- [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating) targeting [Karn Liberated](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn Liberated )   
- Karn, Silver Golem ability targeting the now artifact Karn Liberated  
- [Cytoshape](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cytoshape) choosing the nonlegendary Karn Liberated and targeting Karn, Silver Golem  
  
and viola, you now have a modernized version of Karn for the turn.
posts.html:
You can turn this guy into his Planeswalker version with the help of his own ability.

- Liquimetal Coating targeting Karn Liberated
- Karn, Silver Golem ability targeting the now artifact Karn Liberated
- Cytoshape choosing the nonlegendary Karn Liberated and targeting Karn, Silver Golem

and viola, you now have a modernized version of Karn for the turn.

Posted By: PonchoGrande (10/31/2012 4:46:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Fun fact:  
  
This is the only Legendary Artifact Creature with NO color identity as a Commander.  
  
Per new rulings, [Bosh, Iron Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bosh, Iron Golem) is red, [Memnarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnarch) is blue, and of course [Sen Triplets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sen Triplets) and [Sharuum, the Hegemon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sharuum, the Hegemon) are colored anyway.  
  
It's really a pity the new [Colossus of Akros](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Colossus of Akros) is not Legendary, it would have been the second one.
posts.html:
Fun fact:

This is the only Legendary Artifact Creature with NO color identity as a Commander.

Per new rulings, Bosh, Iron Golem is red, Memnarch is blue, and of course Sen Triplets and Sharuum, the Hegemon are colored anyway.

It's really a pity the new Colossus of Akros is not Legendary, it would have been the second one.

Posted By: tantallum99 (4/9/2011 2:03:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: What with Mirrodin Besieged coming up, poor Arty Shovelhead, as nicknamed by [Teferi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi), is welded onto a throne in the center of Mirrodin, insanely hearing voices and somehow in charge of the phyrexians. He is slightly resisting the corrupting affects of phyrexian oil, so whether he gets redeemed or not probably depends on who wins the war. I bet remembering "[Jhoira](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jhoira) is my friend" will snap him out of it, as that is something he said to himself every night for centuries.
posts.html:

Posted By: Lifegainwithbite (1/31/2013 10:09:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Well, without being an a-hole using Mycosynth Lattice, you could always use him as a "Are you sure you want to play [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God)? I can turn all of your artifacts into tragedies."  
  
You can also turn the artifact lands into tragedies. In fact, this may be one of the only ways to kill [Darksteel Citadel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Citadel).  
  
I thought his "Turn him into a 0/8 when blocking/blocked" was kind of goofy, but when you're assembling an impressive artifact army, the best thing you could have is a great blocker.
posts.html:
Well, without being an a-hole using Mycosynth Lattice, you could always use him as a "Are you sure you want to play Wrath of God? I can turn all of your artifacts into tragedies."

You can also turn the artifact lands into tragedies. In fact, this may be one of the only ways to kill Darksteel Citadel.

I thought his "Turn him into a 0/8 when blocking/blocked" was kind of goofy, but when you're assembling an impressive artifact army, the best thing you could have is a great blocker.
